meanings.sent1: She likes to profess her love for animals by volunteering at the shelter.
meanings.sent2: He will profess his innocence in front of the judge.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to profess his tricks to the audience before the show.
meanings.sent4: The politician would often profess his dedication to serving the community.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the character will profess his undying loyalty to the king.

meanings.definition: To practice or teach as one's own profession
meanings.sent1: The chef will profess his culinary skills by preparing a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: She decided to profess as a teacher after completing her education degree.
meanings.sent3: The artist would often profess his painting techniques to his students.
meanings.sent4: The doctor would profess his medical knowledge during the seminar.
meanings.sent5: The musician will profess his passion for music through his performances.

meanings.definition: To affirm belief in or allegiance to
meanings.sent1: He will profess his loyalty to the team by giving his best in every game.
meanings.sent2: She likes to profess her faith by attending church regularly.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to profess his admiration for his favorite teacher.
meanings.sent4: The soldier would often profess his dedication to serving his country.
meanings.sent5: The fan will profess his support for the band by attending all their concerts.
